fields.description:
Hi All,

Trying to perform a ListAllMyBuckets as mentioned here http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/API/SOAPListAllMyBuckets.html 

Getting following response on the client

{code}
Error Message: Unable to unmarshall response (Failed to parse XML document with handler class com.amazonaws.services.s3.model.transform.XmlResponsesSaxParser$ListAllMyBucketsHandler)
{code}

Wire dump says following:

{code}
#######
T 10.104.1.168:50022 -> 10.104.1.150:8773 [AP]
GET /services/Walrus/ HTTP/1.1 
Host: 10.104.1.150:8773 
Authorization: AWS XMBBFJDYDY5CRK7MFY3IH:UH7c7ZiG2h5laULCeyXLbqC4rAY= 
Date: Fri, 22 Mar 2013 11:47:05 GMT 
User-Agent: aws-sdk-java/1.4.0 Linux/2.6.32-279.14.1.el6.x86_64 OpenJDK_64-Bit_Server_VM/20.0-b12 
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded; charset=utf-8 
Connection: Keep-Alive 
##
{code}

The response is below:

{code}
T 10.104.1.150:8773 -> 10.104.1.168:50022 [AP]
HTTP/1.1 200 OK 
Content-Length: 642 
Content-Type: application/xml 
{code}

And the XML response is below:

{code}
<ListAllMyBucketsResult xmlns="http://s3.amazonaws.com/doc/2006-03-01/" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
<Owner>
<ID>979477180823</ID>
<DisplayName>eucalyptus</DisplayName>
</Owner>
<Buckets>
<Bucket>
<Name>centos6</Name>
<CreationDate>Fri, 22 Mar 2013 11:06:52 GMT</CreationDate>
</Bucket>
<Bucket>
<Name>centos6-kernel</Name>
<CreationDate>Fri, 22 Mar 2013 11:17:23 GMT</CreationDate>
</Bucket>
<Bucket>
<Name>centos6-img</Name>
<CreationDate>Fri, 22 Mar 2013 11:21:10 GMT</CreationDate>
</Bucket>
<Bucket>
<Name>centos6-ramdisk</Name>
<CreationDate>Fri, 22 Mar 2013 11:18:55 GMT</CreationDate>
</Bucket>
</Buckets>
</ListAllMyBucketsResult>
{code}

Seems like the XML response breaks the client. Please let me know if there are any additional questions.

Cheers!
Deependra

comments.body:
Not sure but seems like the fix for EUCA-3978 seems to have break it:

Please see below

clc/modules/msgs/src/main/java/org/apache/tools/ant/util/DateUtils.java
{code}
117: public static final String RFC822_DATETIME_PATTERN = "EEE, dd MMM yyyy HH:mm:ss z";
{code}

Modified this to

clc/modules/msgs/src/main/java/org/apache/tools/ant/util/DateUtils.java
{code}
117: public static final String RFC822_DATETIME_PATTERN = "yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSS'Z'";
{code}

Now it works with the client, most importantly this client is AWS JAVA SDK 1.4.0 without a single patch in it, and it just works now.

Following was the XML response now

{code}
<ListAllMyBucketsResult xmlns="http://s3.amazonaws.com/doc/2006-03-01/" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
<Owner>
<ID>979477180823</ID>
<DisplayName>eucalyptus</DisplayName>
</Owner>
<Buckets>
<Bucket>
<Name>centos6</Name>
<CreationDate>2013-03-22T11:06:52.132Z</CreationDate>
</Bucket>
<Bucket>
<Name>centos6-kernel</Name>
<CreationDate>2013-03-22T11:17:23.759Z</CreationDate>
</Bucket>
<Bucket>
<Name>centos6-img</Name>
<CreationDate>2013-03-22T11:21:10.550Z</CreationDate>
</Bucket>
<Bucket>
<Name>centos6-ramdisk</Name>
<CreationDate>2013-03-22T11:18:55.507Z</CreationDate>
</Bucket>
</Buckets>
</ListAllMyBucketsResult>
{code}

Hope this helps!

Cheers!
Deependra
Discovered while testing the fix of EUCA-3978

Quoted from here:

http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/SOAPAuthentication.html

"Timestamp: This must be a dateTime (go to http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema-2/#dateTime) in the Coordinated Universal Time (Greenwich Mean Time) time zone, such as 2009-01-01T12:00:00.000Z. Authorization will fail if this timestamp is more than 15 minutes away from the clock on Amazon S3 servers."

Ah, yes. Shouldn't have changed the date for this particular response. They are using a different format here than in other places. I mistakenly replaced all the 'Last-Modified' dates but the format for such dates in the Headers for responses needed to change but not the values in the XML of the response body itself. This will affect GET bucket, GET bucket?versions, etc.

Thanks [~dshekhawat], I'll update this ticket when the fix is in.
This one missed the bug scrub.  Removing Zach from the assignee field so this will hit the scrub and can be prioritized.
This is a hot one that blocks our AWS Compat testing, so if we could move this to the top of the queue in triage, that would be helpful.

Which client tool is this?

On Apr 9, 2013, at 8:49 PM, "Greg DeKoenigsberg (JIRA)"

Ah just saw the user-agent header.

We are trying this against 3.3/testing?
AWS JAVA SDK, AWS Ruby SDK, s3cmd and others can chime in, almost all are broken.
3.3 in testing commit ID is 5d65e5ba62f3571d288da758878392097e3117d9 , from april 6th 2013, i can test on latest if there is any update on this bug.

No, no updates. This looks like a regression during 3.3 dev.

On Apr 9, 2013, at 9:55 PM, "Deependra Shekhawat (JIRA)"
Yeah, this is a regression as a consequence of EUCA-3978.

Please try "testing" again and let me know.

commit 9ee0d0574b827ef79e94ce8cdea11f9bc882f29a
Author: Neil Soman <neil@eucalyptus.com>
Date:   Thu Apr 11 20:23:45 2013 -0700

    S3 XML elements use ISO8601.
    
    Fixes EUCA-5515

Hi [~neil],

After debugging some more, it appears to be happening after this commit from [~mspaulding]

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus/commit/10c518042bafd25e4bc343bd8883e6588ca56be1

Basically what happens after this, when you try to bootstrap the system , it does not work, because /usr/sbin/eucalyptus-cloud defaults on using Java 1.6 and the libs are now not in the classpath anymore, because of the commit.

If you force Java 1.7 to the system for runtime, it fails saying this in startup.log

{code}
10830 [main] FATAL com.eucalyptus.bootstrap.SystemBootstrapper  - java.lang.VerifyError: Expecting a stackmap frame at branch target 12 in method edu.ucsb.eucalyptus.msgs.BaseMessage.JiBX_ec2_amazonaws_com_doc_2009_04_04_newinstance_1_0(Ledu/ucsb/eucalyptus/msgs/BaseMessage;Lorg/jibx/runtime/impl/UnmarshallingContext;)Ledu/ucsb/eucalyptus/msgs/BaseMessage; at offset 1
java.lang.VerifyError: Expecting a stackmap frame at branch target 12 in method edu.ucsb.eucalyptus.msgs.BaseMessage.JiBX_ec2_amazonaws_com_doc_2009_04_04_newinstance_1_0(Ledu/ucsb/eucalyptus/msgs/BaseMessage;Lorg/jibx/runtime/impl/UnmarshallingContext;)Ledu/ucsb/eucalyptus/msgs/BaseMessage; at offset 1
{code}

Hence, I had to hard reset my local copy of the source just before this commit, compile everything again and delete the following files from /usr/share/eucalyptus/

{code}
slf4j-api-1.7.5.jar jcl-over-slf4j-1.7.5.jar slf4j-log4j12-1.7.5.jar
{code}

Then I could start the system and work properly.

Unfortunately commit for this bug is after the commit from [~mspaulding] 's Java changes, I could not test it, because I could not get a working system at all.

For reference, I am using CentOS 6.4 with both JDK 1.6 and JDK 1.7 installed.

Please do let me know if there are any questions.

Cheers!
Deependra

Hi [~dshekhawat],

So this is completely expected. Sorry for the trouble. I committed changes today to require Java 7 at runtime, and in order for this to work you will also need to use the latest cloud libs from the testing branch (these should be pulled in automatically when building from source).

The library specifically that is causing you trouble is Jibx. You must have version 1.2.5 when compiling/running with Java 7 language features or you will see the error that you mentioned. There shouldn't be any need to remove the slf4j libraries to make this work.

If you are attempting to use packages that were built in the time when the changes were being made, it might be that only the code was updated but the Java libraries were not. If that's the case we'll need to rebuild packages for that commit hash.

Hi [~mspaulding],

Thanks for reaching out, this was the thing that I did to my local source copy, that is checked to use testing

{code}
git pull
make clean
make
make install
{code}

I believe this should have pulled latest cloud libs from testing and if so , it should have not complained about the Jibx stuff at all?

Yes I agree on the slf4j libs part, I had to remove the latest ones because I reverted back your commit, I can surely try this out again using the latest ones.

Ok [~neil] , looks like this patch has fixed the problem. I can now see the output of ListAllMyBuckets using AWS JAVA SDK 1.4.0

{code}

[~neil] and [~viglesias], since Deependra tested this can we move to Release pending?  Don't want to create more work if its already been verified.

[~tjcramer]

Sounds good to me. Thanks [~dshekhawat]!

Yeah, I also tested with s3cmd.
